intro: Psychotria straminea, commonly known as the yellow psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. It produces small, elliptical berries that contain the seeds. Psychotria straminea is often found in understory habitats of rainforests and is noted for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices.
